This is anecdotal, but throughout my life, I've worked under 6 melanin women and they've all been a fucking nightmare of petty power trips and nonsensical management decisions that would always blow up in their face and then they would immediately cry racism when held accountable.  They would spend all day trying to fuck you over if they detected any sort of perceived slight from messing with your schedule to just outright lying about things you said.

It's almost like flipping a switch.  2 of those women were halfway decent and generally amiable people until they got a promotion and over the weekend became stuck up "boss bish" types.

It's fucking wild to see.

replies.author: @-.-Monster
replies.text:
@JaysSavvy This is when someone comes in and says "it's not all of them"

Then i comment under that with "just the majority"

Then they call me some slanderous word

Then another random guy comes in and says "generalizing people is wrong"

Then i come back to check the comment replies and say "If 8 out of 10 burgers gave you an illness you would stop eating burgers right?"

They respond with something along the lines of "they're not burgers, they're people"

Then i respond with "generalizing is a form of self protection; it's human instinct"

Then a different liberal chimes in with "It's human instinct to be hateful?"

Then i respond with "yes" < --- this one gets a lot of upvotes

Then they respond with "this is what's wrong with people today"

Then i respond with "are you generalizing"

then it kind of fades away into nothing because they never respond after that...

author: @davidnicholas7516
text: I'm going to go out on a limb and say that cop shoplifting (should we call it "coplifting"?) is nothing new. Back several years ago, we had the controversy involving the "Golden State Killer" who was connected via DNA to a series of burglaries, then a series of home invasion robberies and rapes, then a series of murders, all in California. When they finally caught the guy (via DNA profiles submitted to 23 & Me, etc.) it turned out the guy had been a cop...and he'd been fired years before, after being caught shoplifting.
